disclaimerData.disclaimer:
PATIENT AGREEMENT: This form provides information about the advantages and risks of laser skin rejuvenation for intimate areas (vulva, perianal, inner labia) using fractional CO2, Erbium, or non-ablative lasers. Read thoroughly and discuss with your practitioner before proceeding.

Take time to consider all options, seek second opinions, and ask questions. The laser delivers controlled thermal energy to stimulate collagen remodeling, improve skin texture/elasticity, reduce pigmentation, and enhance tightness without surgery. Topical numbing applied; sessions last 15-30 minutes. Typically 3-5 treatments spaced 4-6 weeks apart; improvements visible at 1-3 months with continued enhancement up to 6 months.

Expect mild swelling/redness 2-5 days; avoid intercourse, tampons, hot baths 5-7 days post-treatment. Strict hygiene essential; informed of practitioner each session, withdraw consent anytime.

RISKS AND POSSIBLE REACTIONS: Common: discomfort, redness, swelling, sensitivity (resolves 3-7 days). Less common: prolonged tenderness, hyperpigmentation, dryness, yeast infection flare.

Rare: burns, scarring, infection, herpes reactivation, dyspareunia (painful intercourse), permanent sensation changes. Contraindications: active infections (UTI, herpes, bacterial vaginosis), pregnancy/breastfeeding, recent childbirth (wait 6 months), keloid history, photosensitive medications.

I confirm understanding of procedure reasons, risks (including not treating), personal health risks, benefits, alternatives (topicals, PRP), uncertainties, follow-up care.

MEDICAL IMAGERY: I authorize clinical photos/videos for confidential records.

I certify reading/understanding this form, questions answered satisfactorily, and consent to procedure.

questions.content: Do you comprehend the details that have been given to you?
Do you believe enough information has been shared to allow you to give informed consent?
Have you given your consent voluntarily?
Are there any health issues you currently have?
Are you currently pregnant or nursing a child?
Do you suffer from a neuromuscular disorder (such as Multiple Sclerosis, ALS, motor neuropathy, myasthenia gravis, or Lambert-Eaton syndrome)?
Do you have an autoimmune condition?
Do you experience any skin problems?
Do you have any known allergies or a history of severe allergic reactions (anaphylaxis)?
Is there an active infection at the area where the procedure is planned?
Are you currently on any antibiotics or other prescribed medications?
Is there any other Medical or Social History we should be aware of? If yes, please explain in detail.
What are your goals and desired results for undergoing this procedure? Please elaborate.
Have you undergone this or a comparable treatment previously? If so, were there any issues? Please provide details.
Do you have any concerns? If so, please describe them.
Is there anything else we need to know? Please provide full information.
I will keep this information for the duration of my treatment and consult it as needed.
